AutoChangeMode: The auto change mode (auto-key, auto-track or none).
KeyInterpolation: The interpolation type for newly created keyframes
bAutoSetTrackDefaults: When setting keys on properties and transforms automatically update the track default values used when there are no keys.
SpawnPosition: The default location of a spawnable when it is first dragged into the viewport from the content browser.
bCreateSpawnableCameras: Enable or disable creating of spawnable cameras whenever cameras are created.
bShowRangeSlider: Show the in/out range in the timeline with respect to the start/end range.
bIsSnapEnabled: Enable or disable snapping in the timeline.
bSnapKeyTimesToInterval: Enable or disable snapping keys to the time snapping interval.
bSnapKeyTimesToKeys: Enable or disable snapping keys to other keys.
bSnapSectionTimesToInterval: Enable or disable snapping sections to the time snapping interval.
bSnapSectionTimesToSections: Enable or disable snapping sections to other sections.
bSnapKeysAndSectionsToPlayRange: Enable or disable keeping keys and sections in the playback range.
bSnapPlayTimeToKeys: Enable or disable snapping the playhead to keys while scrubbing.
bSnapPlayTimeToSections: Enable or disable snapping the playhead to section bounds while scrubbing.
bSnapPlayTimeToMarkers: Enable or disable snapping the playhead to markers while scrubbing.
bSnapPlayTimeToInterval: Enable or disable snapping the playhead to the time snapping interval while scrubbing.
bSnapPlayTimeToPressedKey: Enable or disable snapping the playhead to the pressed key.
bSnapPlayTimeToDraggedKey: Enable or disable snapping the playhead to the dragged key.
bSnapCurveValueToInterval: Enable or disable snapping the curve value to the curve value interval.
bShowSelectedNodesOnly: Only show selected nodes in the tree view.
bRewindOnRecord: Defines whether to jump back to the start of the sequence when a recording is started
bLeftMouseDragDoesMarquee: Defines whether left mouse drag does marquee select instead of camera orbit
ZoomPosition: Whether to zoom in on the current position or the current time in the timeline.
bAutoScrollEnabled: Enable or disable auto scroll in the timeline when playing.
bLinkCurveEditorTimeRange: Enable or disable linking the curve editor time range to the sequencer timeline's time range.
bSynchronizeCurveEditorSelection: When enabled, changing the sequencer tree selection will also select the relevant nodes in the curve editor tree if possible.
bIsolateCurveEditorToSelection: When enabled, changing the sequencer tree selection will isolate (auto-filter) the selected nodes in the curve editor.
bResetPlayheadWhenNavigating: Enable or disable resetting the playhead when navigating in and out of subsequences.
bKeepCursorInPlayRangeWhileScrubbing: Enable or disable keeping the playhead in the current playback range while scrubbing.
bKeepPlayRangeInSectionBounds: Enable or disable keeping the playback range constrained to the section bounds.
ZeroPadFrames: The number of zeros to pad the frame numbers by.
JumpFrameIncrement: The number of frames to jump by when jumping forward or backwards.
bShowLayerBars: Enable or disable the layer bars to edit keyframes in bulk.
bShowKeyBars: Enable or disable key bar connections.
bInfiniteKeyAreas: Enable or disable setting key area sections as infinite by default.
bShowChannelColors: Enable or disable displaying channel bar colors for the key bars.
bShowInfoButton: Enable or disable displaying the info button in the playback controls.
bShowTickLines: Enable or disable displaying the tick lines.
bShowSequencerToolbar: Enable or disable displaying the sequencer toolbar.
KeyAreaCurveExtents: The key area curve extents, stored per channel name
KeyAreaHeightWithCurves: The key area height when showing curves
ReduceKeysTolerance: The tolerance to use when reducing keys
bDeleteKeysWhenTrimming: Enable or disable deleting keys that fall beyond the section range when trimming.
bDisableSectionsAfterBaking: Whether to disable sections after baking as opposed to deleting.
bCleanPlaybackMode: When enabled, sequencer will playback in clean mode (game view, hide viewport UI)
bActivateRealtimeViewports: When enabled, sequencer will activate 'Realtime' in viewports
bEvaluateSubSequencesInIsolation: When enabled, entering a sub sequence will evaluate that sub sequence in isolation, rather than from the root sequence
bRerunConstructionScripts: When enabled, construction scripts will be rerun on bound actors for every frame
bShowDebugVisualization: Enable or disable showing of debug visualization.
bVisualizePreAndPostRoll: Enable or disable showing of pre and post roll visualization.
bCompileDirectorOnEvaluate: Whether to recompile the director blueprint when the sequence is evaluated (if one exists)
TrajectoryPathCap: Specifies the maximum number of keys to draw when rendering trajectories in viewports
FrameNumberDisplayFormat: What format do we display time in to the user?
bAutoExpandNodesOnSelection: Whether to expand the sequencer tree view when a child element is selected (from outside of the tree view).
bRestoreOriginalViewportOnCameraCutUnloc:
Whether unlocking a camera cut track should return the viewport to its original location, or keep it where the
camera cut was.
WARNING: Disabling this will make previewing camera cut blends useless, since it will blend to the same position.
TrackFilters: The track filters that are enabled
ColumnVisibilitySettings: List of all columns and their visibility, in the order to be displayed in the outliner view
